page.title: 16Cramlington:Dialect
page.content:
The local dialect of Cramlington is dying out quickly because of the new people coming into the town. Here are a few examples of words people used to use before newcomers took over: {Raa.............}A row of houses {Lonnen.. .......}A lane between houses {Netty...........}An outside lavatory {Pant............}An outside pump {Wagonway........}Mineral railway line {Rolly...........}A truck for the above {Dolly-heap......}Ash heap from a{netty {Gallowa.........}A pit pony {Syke............}A drainage ditch {Spuggy..........}A house sparrow {Store...........}The Co-operative shop {Proggy/Clppy Mat}A mat woven of cloth clippings on hessian
Klondyke F.S.
